p: The main reason for the declining biocapacity in Australia was the deforestation. The country is under the risk of desertification. Forest areas equivalent to 1000 rugby fields have been destroyed on a daily basis, especially in the state of Queensland (Taner, 2020).2 Australian farmers aim to open pasture fields for cattle and the acquisition of agricultural land. However, some farmers conduct these activities in an illegal way. Thus, the existence of Australia’s national forests continues to decline.
